TopicTitle: Weird behaviour of debris after decoupling during reentry

Articles.Content:
Hi!

I have reentered the atmosphere of Kerbin with a small ship (bottom to top: Terrier, small 1,25m tank (3/4 full), science jr., KV-2 with some small stuff on top). At 33.000m and about 2100 m/s I engaged the built-in decoupler of the reentry pod, having angled the ship slightly away from retrograde.

From previous experience, what I expected to happen was that the tank would stay close, being slowed down at a different but comparable rate.

What really happened was that the debris "sped up", as if from one moment to the other it experienced dramatically less drag. It  raced 300m ahead of me in a matter of a second or two and kept going... I have tried the same with an empty tank with a similar result.

I haven't played in a while, but that strikes me as odd. Is anyone seeing something similar?
